abstract: San Francisco Giants pitcher Chris Heston is one of many players who value printed tickets as souvenirs of memorable games, particularly at time when very few tickets are printed; more sports fans print out tickets on their home printers or simply use their smartphones, which has increased value of actual printed tickets; some companies have tried to capitalize on relative lack by creating reproductions of tickets of famous games.
lead_paragraph: In recent years, an increasing number of fans have strode through turnstiles with their ticket printed on a sheet of 8.5-by-11-inch copy paper or with the bar code for their seat displayed on a smartphone.

headline.main: As Bar Codes Replace Tickets, Something Is Lost Before the First Pitch

snippet: In recent years, an increasing number of fans have strode through turnstiles with their ticket printed on a sheet of 8.5-by-11-inch copy paper or with the bar code for their seat displayed on a smartphone.
